body_html:
I have opened the ticket as soon as I got the error. First, they have closed it saying that it was a duplicate, it was not. Then they have reopened it but set it to "Low" priority, yeah a system breaking bug is not important as it seems. Now, the repo maintainer haven't fixed the issue for days.

  1. mistakes happen
  2. https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Reporting_bug_guidelines#Severity
    I do not read this issue as something that renders the entire package completely unusable. It absolutely, positively, cannot be described as "system breaking", something which you acknowledged when you opted for reporting it as high-severity rather than critical...

Your aggressive attitude on the bugtracker and continued polemic here is not helping. Severities exist for a reason, and marking a bug as a lower priority is not a personal attack against you. Though if you absolutely insist and it would make you feel better, we can probably arrange for one...

I do not read this issue as something that renders the entire package completely unusable. It absolutely, positively, cannot be described as "system breaking", something which you acknowledged when you opted for reporting it as high-severity rather than critical...

body:
> I have opened the ticket as soon as I got the error. First, they have closed it saying that it was a duplicate, it was not. Then they have reopened it but set it to "Low" priority, yeah a system breaking bug is not important as it seems. Now, the repo maintainer haven't fixed the issue for days.

1) mistakes happen
2) https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Reporting_bug_guidelines#Severity
I do not read this issue as something that renders the entire package completely unusable. It absolutely, positively, cannot be described as "system breaking", something which you acknowledged when you opted for reporting it as high-severity rather than critical...


Your aggressive attitude on the bugtracker and continued polemic here is not helping. Severities exist for a reason, and marking a bug as a lower priority is not a personal attack against you. Though if you absolutely insist and it would make you feel better, we can probably arrange for one...
